channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Some voters who backed Trump say ICE is going 'too far'
item.description: A new focus group of Biden-to-Trump voters weighs in on immigration operations and Trump's foreign affairs leadership on Greenland and Venezuela.

item.title: Rahm Emanuel critiques Democrats and offers advice for the upcoming midterms
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.

item.title: Jack Smith to defend Trump investigations to House Republicans

item.title: What we know about Trump's 'framework of future deal' over Greenland
item.description: Denmark and Greenland have made it clear they will not relinquish sovereignty of the world's largest island.

item.title: Japan suspends world's largest nuclear plant hours after restart
item.description: The operator says reactor remains "stable" and has no "radioactive impact outside".

item.title: UK holds off joining Trump's Board of Peace over Putin concerns
item.description: Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper says the Russian president has shown no commitment to peace in Ukraine.

item.title: Have IRS Fresh Start program qualifications changed in 2026? Here's what to know.
item.description: Any changes made to the IRS Fresh Start program could affect whether you're eligible for this type of tax relief.

item.title: Homicide rate declines sharply in dozens of US cities, a new report shows
Ex-intelligence officer accused of betraying Austria in Russia spying trial
item.description: Egisto Ott, 63, denies charges of handing over information to Russian agents.

item.title: Watch Live: Jack Smith testifies publicly for first time on Trump probes

item.title: 2026 Oscar nominations explained
item.description: The 2026 Oscar nominations have been announced, and "Sinners" has 16 chances to win. Fandango's Erik Davis breaks down what to expect.

item.title: Ugandan MP and Bobi Wine ally arrested over election violence
item.description: The opposition politician is accused of election violence in which at least seven people were killed.
